intro: Millettia eetveldeana var. eetveldeana, commonly known as the Eetvelde's millettia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces legumes as its fruit, which contain several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
